EnablingAuthority.XRefExternal: DEPARTMENT OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS, TRADE AND DEVELOPMENT ACT

Identification.LongTitle: Regulations Prescribing the Travel Documents for Which Fees are Payable and the Amount of Those Fees, with a View to the Recovery of Costs of Providing Consular Services

Provision.Text: His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Foreign Affairs and the Treasury Board, pursuant to section 10.1* of the Department of Foreign Affairs and International Trade Act**, is pleased hereby to make the annexed Regulations prescribing the travel documents for which fees are payable and the amount of those fees, with a view to the recovery of costs of providing consular services.

Section.Text: These Regulations may be cited as the Consular Services Fees Regulations.

Definition.Text: travel document means any of the following documents that are issued by the Minister for travel purposes:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a passport issued pursuant to the Canadian Passport Order;

Section.Text: A travel document is subject to the payment of the fee set out in section 4.
The fee for a travel document that is issued to a person of at least 16 years of age is $25 and shall be paid when the application for the document is made.

Section 4 of the Regulations, as it read immediately before the coming into force of these Regulations, continues to apply in respect of an application to a passport issuing office for a travel document that is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: made in person before that coming into force; or

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: before that coming into force, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: within five days after that coming into force if the application is accompanied by the fee referred to in that section.
